gaia::net::IHttpClientListener Class Reference

IHttpClientListener handles callback functions in each stage of HttpClient. More...

#include <IHttpClientListener.h>

Detailed Description

IHttpClientListener handles callback functions in each stage of HttpClient.

(Start) -> onReceivedRedirect* -> onResponseStarted -> onReadCompleted* -> onCompleted.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void gaia::net::IHttpClientListener::onAuthRequired ( const AuthInfo &  authInfo,
HttpClient *  client 
) [virtual]

Called when remote host requires authentication.

If a response cames with an auth requirement, this function will be called. To continue the procedure, call continueAuth() of client who calls this function with username and password, or call cancel auth with cancelAuth() of client. This function SHOULD NOT be blocked.

Parameters:
authInfoAuth info of the require.
clientHttpClient that calls this function.
virtual void gaia::net::IHttpClientListener::onCertificateRequested ( SSLRequestInfo *  certRequestInfo,
HttpClient *  client 
) [virtual]

Called when we receive an SSL CertificateRequest message for client authentication.

The delegate should call request->ContinueWithCertificate() with the client certificate the user selected, or request->continueWithCertificate(NULL) to continue the SSL handshake without a client certificate.

Parameters:
certRequestInfoInformation of the certification.
clientHttpClient that calls this method.

Called when the end of response stream is reached.

virtual void gaia::net::IHttpClientListener::onReadComplete ( size_t  readLength,
HttpClient *  client 
) [pure virtual]

Called when the a Read of the response body is completed after a readResponse() call.

The data read is filled into the buffer which the caller passed to readResponse() previously.

Parameters:
readLengthlength of the data.
clientHttpClient that calls this method.
virtual void gaia::net::IHttpClientListener::onReceivedRedirect ( const Url &  newUrl,
HttpClient *  client 
) [virtual]

Called upon a server-initiated redirect.

The delegate may call the request's Cancel method to prevent the redirect from being followed. Since there may be multiple chained redirects, there may also be more than one redirect call.

Parameters:
clientHttpClient that calls this method.
newUrlThe url that we are about to be directed to.
virtual void gaia::net::IHttpClientListener::onResponseStarted ( HttpClient *  client) [pure virtual]

After calling start(), the delegate will receive an onResponseStarted callback when the request has completed.

On success, all redirects have been followed and the final response is beginning to arrive. At this point, meta data about the response is available, including for example HTTP response headers if this is a request for a HTTP resource.

Parameters:
clientHttpClient that calls this method.
virtual void gaia::net::IHttpClientListener::onSSLCertificateError ( RESULT  result,
gaia::security::X509Certificate *  cert,
HttpClient *  client 
) [virtual]

Called when using SSL and the server responds with a certificate with an error, for example, whose common name does not match the common name we were expecting for that host.

The delegate should either do the safe thing and cancel() the request or decide to proceed by calling continueDespiteLastError().

Parameters:
resultAn error code.
certCertificate that cause error.
clientHttpClient that calls this method.
